item.title: Anatomy of Ruby Exception
item.description: Today I was trying to find how to properly override Ruby standard Exception. To my surprise, I was not able to find any tutorial or even paragraph about it. No recommendations, no design patterns. Everything was the same: class MyError < StandardError; end As a Java guy, I tend to encapsulate lots of things into Exceptions. It's not a bad thing, actually it is a good thing. So I asked myself - what should I override, how, and why?
